# Time & Unit Conversions

## Hours and Minutes to Seconds

**Rule**

$$
\text{seconds} = \text{hours} \times 3600 + \text{minutes} \times 60
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Seconds to Hours, Minutes, Seconds

**Rule**

$$
\text{hours} = \left\lfloor \frac{\text{seconds}}{3600} \right\rfloor
$$

$$
\text{remaining} = \text{seconds} \bmod 3600
$$

$$
\text{minutes} = \left\lfloor \frac{\text{remaining}}{60} \right\rfloor
$$

$$
\text{seconds}_{\text{left}} = \text{remaining} \bmod 60
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Celsius to Fahrenheit

**Rule**

$$
F = C \times \frac{9}{5} + 32
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Geometry & Measurement

## Rectangle Area

**Rule**

$$
A = l \times w
$$

$$
\text Area = length *width
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Rectangle Perimeter

**Rule**

$$
P = 2(l + w)
$$

$$
\text Area = 2*(length *width)
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Circle Area

**Rule**

$$
A = \pi r^2
$$

$$
\text Area = pi*radius^2
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Triangle Perimeter

**Rule**

$$
P = a + b + c
$$

Sum of all four sides of the rectangle.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Triangle Area (Heron's Formula)

**Rule**

$$
s = \frac{a + b + c}{2}
$$

$$
A = \sqrt{s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}
$$

Computes triangle area using only side lengths.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Finance & Rates

## Percentage Discount

**Rule**

$$
\text{discounted price} = \text{original price} \times (1 - d)
$$

where ( d ) is the discount rate.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Compound Interest

**Rule**

$$
A = P(1 + r)^t
$$

where\
( P ) = principal\
( r ) = interest rate\
( t ) = time

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Health & Science

## Body Mass Index (BMI)

**Rule**

$$
\text{BMI} = \frac{\text{weight}}{\text{height}^2}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Arithmetic Rules

## Modulo (Remainder)

**Rule**

$$
a \bmod b = \text{remainder of } \frac{a}{b}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Even / Odd Check

**Rule**

$$
\text{even} \iff n \bmod 2 = 0
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Floor Division

**Rule**

$$
a \mathbin{//} b = \left\lfloor \frac{a}{b} \right\rfloor
$$

Divides and rounds down to the nearest integer. (Full number)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Sequences & Series

## Fibonacci Sequence

**Rule**

$$
F_n = F_{n-1} + F_{n-2}
$$

with initial values ( F_0 = 0, F_1 = 1 ).

Each term equals the sum of the two preceding ones.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# String Logic (Conceptual)

## String Repetition

**Rule**

$$
\text{text} \times n = \text{text concatenated } n \text{ times}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Palindrome Check

**Rule**

$$
\text{string} = \text{reverse(string)}
$$

Reads same forward as backwards:\
Nun\
Mom\
Madam

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Substring Extraction

**Rule**

$$
\text{substring} = \text{characters from index } i \text{ to } j-1
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Lists & Sets

## Second Largest Element

**Rule**

$$
\text{sort descending} \rightarrow \text{take second element}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Filtering by Condition

**Rule**

$$
\{x \mid \text{condition}(x) = \text{true}\}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Flatten Nested Lists

**Rule**

$$
[[a,b],[c,d]] \rightarrow [a,b,c,d]
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Dictionary Logic

## Grouping by Key

**Rule**

$$
\text{group elements sharing the same property}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Set Theory

## Union

**Rule**

$$
A \cup B = \{x \mid x \in A \text{ or } x \in B\}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Intersection

**Rule**

$$
A \cap B = \{x \mid x \in A \text{ and } x \in B\}
$$

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Difference

**Rule**

$$
A - B = \{x \mid x \in A \text{ and } x \notin B\}
$$
